anchorMove.name: Spell-Slinger Luck Special
anchorMove.description: When you spend Luck, the official council of wizards is going to poke their nose into your business.

additionalMoves.name: Combat Magic
additionalMoves.description: You have a few attack spells you can use as weapons. When you use these spells for necessary violence, roll +Weird instead of +Vigor. Sometimes the situation may require you to act under pressure to cast your spell without problems. Your combat spells can combine any of your base spells with any of your effects.

arrays.title: Bases
values: Ball: 1-harm magic area close obvious loud

arrays.title: Effects
values: Fire: Add '+2 harm fire' to a base. If you get a 10+ on a combat magic roll, the fire won't spread.

additionalMoves.name: Tools and Techniques
additionalMoves.description: To use your combat magic effectively, you rely on a collection of tools and techniques. Cross off one; you'll need the rest.

arrays.title: Options
values: Consumables: You need certain supplies—powders, oils, etc—on hand, some will be used up each cast. If you don't have them, take 1-harm ignore-armour when you cast.
Foci: You need wands, staves, and other obvious props to focus. If you don't have what you need, your combat magic does 1 less harm.
Gestures: You need to wave your hands around to use combat magic. If you're restrained, take -1 ongoing for combat magic.

additionalMoves.name: Advanced Arcane Training
additionalMoves.description: If you have two of your three Tools and Techniques at the ready, you may ignore the third one.

additionalMoves.name: Practitioner
additionalMoves.description: Choose two effects available to you under use magic. Take +1 to use magic whenever you choose one of those effects.

additionalMoves.name: Shield Spell
additionalMoves.description: When you protect someone, gain 2-armour against any harm that is transferred to you. This doesn't stack with your other armour, if any.
